abstract.para: The &cloud; ‐ is a Web interface that allows cloud administrators to manage various &ostack; services, like managing and creating images, creating keypairs, or attaching volumes to instances. It is based on &ostack; ‐ (also known as Horizon). taroth 2012-07-04: not sure about the CLI - if it has the same scope, a basic administration chapter in front of this one migth be useful to explain the underlying logic - maybe something for next revision

sect1.title: Requirements
sect1.para: A recent Web browser that supports HTML5. It must have cookies and JavaScript enabled. For using the ‐'s VNC client, which is based on noVNC, your browser needs to support HTML5 Canvas and HTML5 WebSockets. For more details and a list of browsers that support noVNC, refer to , and , respectively.
The &cloud; ‐ back-end runs on the node that has the nova-dashboard server role.

sect2.title: Logging Into the &cloud; ‐ as Administrator
sect2.para: To access the &cloud; ‐, ask the administrator of the &cloud; &admserv; for the following information:

listitem.para: Public IP address of the node that has the nova-dashboard barclamp applied.
User name and password of the cloud administrator user with which you can log in to &cloud; ‐.

step.para: On any machine, start a Web browser and make sure that JavaScript and cookies are enabled.taroth 2012-07-04: DEVs, does the machine running the browser need to be in the same network like the node which provides the WEB UI? or can it be accessed from anywhere? cthiel 2012-07-05: that depends on the network setup of the customer
As URL, enter the IP address that you got from the &admserv;'s administrator.

note.title: Certificate Warning
note.para: Depending on your browser and browser options, you may get a certificate warning when trying to access the URL for the first time. This is because in case no certificate is provided when setting up the ‐, &productname; uses a self-signed certificate that is not considered trustworthy per default.

To proceed anyway, you can add an exception in the browser to bypass the warning. To avoid the warning in the first place, replace the self-signed certificate with a certificate signed by an official Certificate Authority.

step.para: On the &cloud; ‐ login screen, enter the User Name and Password and click Sign In.
The ‐ screen appears, showing a Project and an Admin tab.

sect2.title: Main Screen
sect2.para: The top of the main screen shows the username with which you are logged in, and allows you to access the Settings or to Sign Out.

note.title: Available Functions
note.para: The visible tabs and functions in the ‐ depend on the access permissions of the user that is logged in.

sect2.para: The Project tab shows details for the projects (or tenants) that the user who is logged in belongs to. Select a Project from the drop-down list at the left-hand corner to view some basic reports in the Overview category, to access Instances & Volumes created by users of the project, list Images & Snapshots created for the project or to allocate or release floating IP addresses, manage security groups and keypairs in the Access & Security category.

The Admin tab shows some basic metrics in the Overview category. The Instances category lists all currently running instances belonging to various users and &tenants;. (Not all tenants may be visible to the administrator, though). From there, you can terminate, pause, or reboot any instances or connect to them via VNC. The Services category shows the list of services defined. The Flavors category list the available sizes of the VMs that you may launch. The Images category shows the custom images that have been uploaded and lets you edit image properties or delete images, if needed. The Project category lists the available tenants. From here, you can create new projects and assign users to the projects. The Users category gives an overview of all users.
